citation.article-title: Porphyrobacter neustonensis gen. nov., sp. nov., an aerobic bacteriochlorophyll-synthesizing budding bacterium from fresh water.

p.s: Description of Porphyrobacter neustonensis sp. nov.

Porphyrobacter neustonensis (neu.sto.nen'is M.L. masc. adj. derived from Gr. n. neustos, swimming [floating], referring to occurrence of the bacterium as a member of the neuston [organisms floating at the air-water interface surface layer of a body of water])
Octadecenoic acid (18:1) is the major cellular fatty acid.
Utilizes glucose, galactose, maltose, mannose, sucrose, xylose, arginine, glutamine, and proline as sole carbon sources; does not utilize acetate, glutamate, or butyrate or require vitamins.
Lives at the air-water interface of freshwater subtropical pond.
